title: How to Make Deux Foie Gras

methods.name: Prepare the Vanilla and Kumquat Compote:

steps.headline: First, pour honey into a pot.
Split the vanilla bean and scrape the vanilla seeds into the honey.
Add sliced kumquats, red wine vinegar and water.
Afterwards, set aside to cool until ready to use.

methods.name: Prepare the Foie Gras crème Brulee:

steps.headline: Blend all of the ingredients except the brandy in a blender until smooth.
Add in Brandy.
steps.description: Season to taste. Pass through a fine sieve.

steps.headline: Pour into shot glasses, filling up to the brim of the glass.
Line a gastronome pan with a cloth then place the shot glasses on the cloth.
Fill the pan with hot water until the water reaches ¾ marking of the shot glasses.
Place pan in an oven at 100˚C for 1 hour.
Once cooked, remove from the pan and allow to cool.
Sprinkle sugar on top of the crème Brulee and use a hand torch to caramelize the sugar.
Dust the foie gras lightly with the flour.
Sautee on both sides until brown while keeping it soft in the middle.
Finally, arrange foie gras on plates and serve.

text: Prepare the Vanilla and Kumquat Compote: First, pour honey into a pot.  Split the vanilla bean and scrape the vanilla seeds into the honey.  Caramelize until dark brown.  Add sliced kumquats, red wine vinegar and water.  Cook for 3-5 minutes.  Afterwards, set aside to cool until ready to use.  Prepare the Foie Gras crème Brulee: Blend all of the ingredients except the brandy in a blender until smooth.  Add in Brandy. Season to taste. Pass through a fine sieve. Pour into shot glasses, filling up to the brim of the glass.  Line a gastronome pan with a cloth then place the shot glasses on the cloth.  Fill the pan with hot water until the water reaches ¾ marking of the shot glasses.  Cover tightly with tin foil.  Place pan in an oven at 100˚C for 1 hour.  Once cooked, remove from the pan and allow to cool.  Sprinkle sugar on top of the crème Brulee and use a hand torch to caramelize the sugar.  Prepare the Duck Foie Gras: Dust the foie gras lightly with the flour.  Sautee on both sides until brown while keeping it soft in the middle.  Finally, arrange foie gras on plates and serve.
